column2: around lunchtime this place is something of a madhouse (like
column3: the share your table with strangers kind) so it takes them a little while to get your food out to you.  It's worth the wait
column5: and the people at the front are super charming and helpful.  They did not even roll their eyes with my mom ordered duck confit and pronounced the t
column6: as many a cultured youth might be tempted to do.  So
column8: take your time with the food
